snippet: The proposal, which doesn’t require congressional approval, would grant temporary entry for up to five years to people building start-ups in the U.S....
abstract: Homeland Security Dept proposes immigration rule granting temporary entry to foreign entrepreneurs for up to five years; tech industry applauds plan, as it will ease challenges facing many startup founders, especially those who came to United States as students and began creating new companies here; department expects regulation to take effect as soon as 2017.
lead_paragraph: The proposal, which doesn’t require congressional approval, would grant temporary entry for up to five years to people building start-ups in the U.S.

headline.main: U.S. Proposes Immigration Rule Aimed at Entrepreneurs
headline.print_headline: U.S. Immigration Option Could Aid Entrepreneurs
